theoryKnowledge.deltaMsgFirst: Purpose: To reduce the mean square error (MSE)
theoryKnowledge.deltaMsgSecond: Note: The delta rule is used with linear neurons and differentiable errors;
theoryKnowledge.deltaMsgThird: It produces more continuous and stable updates than the Perceptron rule.
theoryKnowledge.deltaExplanation: The delta rule is a learning method that updates the weights of a single-layer neuron to minimize error. Also known as an online/iterative version of the least squares approximation (LMS), it incrementally refines the weights with a gradient derived from the difference (error) between the output and the target.

theoryKnowledge.perceptronExplanation: The perceptron is the most fundamental building block of artificial neural networks. Developed by Frank Rosenblatt in 1958, this algorithm is used to solve binary classification problems.
